tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the descendants of the godly man will be blessed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will bless the descendants of the godly man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The person who sings this song continues to describe a person who reveres Yahweh.

tn.ref: Wealth and riches are in his house
tn.text: Here the word "house" represents the family. The words "Wealth" and "riches" mean basically the same thing and indicate an abundance of wealth. AT: "His family is very wealthy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Light shines in the darkness for the godly person
tn.text: The writer speaks of God blessing the godly person in difficult times as if it were a light shining in darkness. AT: "The blessings that a godly person receives from God are like a light that shines in the darkness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The understood information can be made clear. AT: "lends his money to other people."  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The person who sings this song continues to describe a person who reveres Yahweh.

tn.ref: For he will never be moved
tn.text: he will not be troubled or overwhelmed by circumstances for his trust is in Yahweh? This can be stated in active form. AT: "For nothing will ever move him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the righteous person will be remembered forever
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will remember the righteous person forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The person who sings this song continues to describe a person who reveres Yahweh.
"His heart is supported." Here the word "heart" refers to the person. Possible meanings are 1) "He is at peace" or 2) "He is confident" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"his righteous deeds will endure forever." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:112:003|112:3]].

tn.ref: he will be exalted with honor
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will exalt him by giving him honor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"will see that things go well for the godly person." The word "this" refers to everything good that the writer has described in the previous verses about the godly person.

tn.ref: he will gnash with his teeth
tn.text: Gnashing one's teeth was a gesture of scorn. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:035:015|35:16]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
The writer speaks of the wicked person's eventual death as if that person were something, such as ice, that can melt. AT: "eventually die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the desire of the wicked people will perish
tn.text: Possible meanings of "desire" are 1) the emotional desire that wicked people have. AT: "the things that wicked people want to do will never happen" or 2) it is a metonym for the things that wicked people have desired. AT: "wicked people will lose the things that they desired" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
